intro: Sanchezia lispa, commonly known as the red-veined stegoma, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Sanchezia lispa produces small, tubular flowers that are usually green or yellowish in color. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental leaves and relatively easy care requirements.
